snippet: The Danish prime minister speaks of a “dark ideology.” This vagueness undermines the Muslims fighting the Islamist scourge.
abstract: Roger Cohen Op-Ed column rejects notion of uncoupling fundamentalist Islam from terrorist attacks like one in Denmark; warns that amounts to empty talk that threatens efforts to combat metastasizing Islamist movement; underscores how vague descriptions of the roots of problem hobbles brave Muslims who are speaking out against jihadists, same brave people who are the only ones who can counteract appeal of groups like Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: The Danish prime minister speaks of a “dark ideology.” This vagueness undermines the Muslims fighting the Islamist scourge.
